main event: Two pilots reported a sighting of an unidentified aerial object at Yokota Air Base, Japan on August 6, 1952. The object was described as a pulsating white light maneuvering at high speeds and then suddenly accelerating and disappearing from view.
interesting points: The pilots observed a single white light pulsating in nature at an estimated altitude of 15,000 feet and a distance of approximately 8 to 10 miles from their position.
The object appeared to be maneuvering at a high rate of speed in various directions before suddenly accelerating and disappearing from view after approximately 2 minutes of observation.
The object was visual from a U-47 aircraft at approximately 10,000 feet traveling at approximately 300 miles per hour.
At one point, the object passed off the tail of the aircraft and did not blink, was not illuminated, and did not have any observed exhaust or vapor trail.
No sound or physical evidence was detected, and no activity or condition, meteorological or otherwise, could explain the sighting.
